CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1953, pg. 14, reads: "Jubilant Jabberwockies - Pittsburgh was treated to the best Jabberwock seen in these parted in many years, according to those who have taken part each year. A gay group of young folk pranced and danced and sang their way right into the hears of a capacity audience.  General chairman was Ardelle Douglass and working with her was a magnificent committee of Delta Sigma Theta sorors...Third photo: talented young dancer Victor Hereford and his dancer provided exotic native dance to the accompaniment of his own drummers and stopped the show with the presentation of 6-year-old Dianne Littlejohn.  Little Miss Littlejohn is shown front, going into her number, backed up by a fast-moving chorus..."
TitMainTitle: Young women and men from Victor Hereford dancers, and six-year-old Dianne Littlejohn in front, wearing Caribbean style costumes, dancing on stage for Delta Sigma Theta Sorority "Coronation Capers Jabberwock"
